sen.j: 『渓嵐拾葉集』第39「常行堂摩多羅神の事」では、天台宗の円仁が中国（唐）で五台山の引声念仏を相伝し、帰国する際に船中で虚空から摩多羅神の声が聞こえて感得、比叡山に常行堂を建立して常行堂へ勧請し、常行三昧を始修して阿弥陀信仰を始めたと記されている。
sen.e: In the section thirty-nine, 'the story of Matarashin in Jogyo-do Hall' of the "Keiran shuyo shu (a literature of the Tendai sect)," there is a description that Ennin, a priest of the Tendai sect, learned Inzei-nenbutsu (invocating nenbutsu slowly) of the Mt. Wutai Shan in China (Tang), was inspired by hearing Matarashin's voice from the air on a ship to go back to Japan, built the Jyogyo-do Hall on Mt.Hiei, performed kanjo (a ceremonial transfer of a divided tutelary deity to a new location) and Jogyo-zammai (absorption in walking around Amitabha, invocating his name and nenbutsu), and began the believing in Amitabha.

sen.j: しかし摩多羅神の祭祀は、平安時代末から鎌倉時代における天台の恵檀二流によるもので、特に檀那流の玄旨帰命壇の成立時と同時期と考えられる。
sen.e: However, the religious service of Matarashin was begun by the Edan Niryu schools of the Tendai sect from the end of the Heian period to the Kamakura period, and especially it is thought to be begun around the same period of the establishment of the Genshi Kimyodan of the Danna school.
